snippet: The outcome of Sunday’s elections is likely to be another blow to a German-designed austerity plan to cure the euro zone’s debt and banking crisis.
abstract: Elections in France and Greece will be closely watched for the future of the European Union and the euro; anxieties are rising again over the shared currency and these elections are likely to be a blow to the German-designed austerity plan to cure the euro zone’s debt and banking crisis.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: The outcome of Sunday’s elections is likely to be another blow to a German-designed austerity plan to cure the euro zone’s debt and banking crisis.

headline.seo: France and Greece Poised for Crucial Votes Sunday
headline.main: Results of French and Greek Elections Could Signal Shift on Economic Crisis
headline.print_headline: Results of French and Greek Elections Could Signal Shift on Economic Crisis
